name: Daka
content:
Daka, also known as Old Daka, was an elderly female Nightsister who lived in the Nightsister lair on her homeworld Dathomir during the Clone Wars. The oldest and wisest of the Nightsisters, her vast knowledge of arcane magicks was unprecedented. As the elder of her clan, Daka passed down her expertise to the other Nightsisters. This lended her the reputation of being the most powerful member of her clan. The clan's leader, Mother Talzin, regarded Daka so in particular. One such ability was resurrecting the dead. The skill was notably used during the Battle of Dathomir, where the sisters stood against the vengeful Count Dooku's Confederacy of Independent Systems. The sisterhood's victory was not to be, however, as Daka was stabbed by one of Supreme Commander of the Droid Army General Grievous' lightsabers. Before death however, Daka was able to direct the witch of no clan Falta to the location of her daughter, who had previously joined the Nightsisters.
Born on the Outer Rim Territories planet Dathomir, Daka lived as a Nightsister witch on the planet Dathomir. Daka served as an elder in her clan, thus being the oldest and wisest. Being an elder, Daka passed down spellcraft and had a vast knowledge on the history of the clan.
In 20 BBY, in retaliation of Asajj Ventress' betrayal and plots against him, the Confederacy of Independent Systems leader Count Dooku dispatched the Kaleesh warlord General Grievous and the Separatist Droid Army to completely wipe out the Nightsisters so they could prove no further threat. When Separatist forces landed and the battle began, Ventress declared to Talzin that the Nightsisters fighting at the frontier would need reinforcements to survive the onslaught brought on by the droid forces.
Listening to Ventress, Talzin journeyed to the Hidden Cave, a hidden room in the Nightsister lair which could be accessed through the use of magick. Talzin came before Old Daka who agreed to use a spell to unleash the undead Nightsisters to help fight the droids. Daka began to enchant and recite a spell which would raise the undead. When the undead army awoke and crawled out of their burial pods, they aided the living Nightsisters in fighting the droids. However, despite the support from the zombies, the Nightsisters were outmatched by the droid army, which pushed forward.
Dooku sent Grievous directly to Talzin in order to kill her before she could complete the spell to take the Count's life. Following the source of the magick, Grievous made his way through the fortress, and had a BX-series droid commando blast through the walls of the Hidden Cave, giving him easy access. Daka was helpless to stop the General, who roughly grabbed her and drove one of his lightsabers into her chest, grievously injuring the eldest of the witches of Dathomir, and flinging her aside. With Daka's spell broken, the undead army fell to ruin, leading to the swift extermination of the rest of the Nightsisters by overwhelming droid forces.
After the battle ended, Falta, a witch of no clan, arrived to search for her daughter Yenna who had joind the Nightsisters long before the battle. As Falta entered the Hidden Cave, she noticed Daka lying in the corner. As she was about to lay the old witch to rest, Daka's eyes opened, having not been dead yet but only unconscious. Before passing away, Daka told her that Yenna had been sent off-world in an escape pod. This began Falta's search for her daughter, which eventually brought her and her pet tooka, Ichor, to the planetoid SÃ­di where she met the young girl, Bug.
Daka was the wisest of the Nightsisters. Old Daka's knowledge of the arcane magicks was unprecedented. Daka was skilled in spiritual guidance and leadership.
Daka stood at 1.83 meters tall, equivalent to 6 feet. Daka had a deep, raspy voice and when reciting spells, she spoke in the Dathomirian language. She had white hair with red streaks in it, silver eyes, and purple tattoos with aged, mottled skin and shrunken eyes.
Daka's mastery of the Nightsister powers was without peer toward the end of her life, as was her knowledge of the clan's abilities. Keeper of the Nightsisters' most dangerous lore, Daka could even perform the Chant of Resurrection, which granted her the ability to raise the dead. Mother Talzin herself could not go about performing the spell, seeking Daka's powers instead. By 20 BBY, Daka was the most powerful and mighty of the Nightsister clan, reflected in her status as the clan Elder. Daka was also able to see into the future.
When using the Chant of Resurrection in 20 BBY, Daka completed the spell using a Witches' Orb and the Talisman of Resurrection. Daka wore a headress of bones and a decorative garment of various colors.
Daka first appeared in the Star Wars: The Clone Wars season four episode "Massacre," released on February 24, 2012. She was voiced by actress Kathleen Gati in the episode.
